Hi.... for people suffering with crashes when trying to create a new player.... I am assuming you have moved your "My Documents" folder onto a seperate partition as I had done. Thanks to EA's coding you will need to restore the whole "my documents" folder back to it's default location. Just right click on My Documents, Properties, then restore default.
This worked a treat for me. You can find the original thread on the EA Forums here http://forum.easports.co.uk/viewtopic.php?t=9819&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=15

Credit to the original poster who discovered this.

And thanks to Reloaded for a fine release

Directx problem?:
The solution is to run autorun.exe in 
Win2000 compatability mode . Create a desktop shortcut to the autorun 
file on the DVD , go to the shortcuts properties and choose to run the file 
in Win 2000 compatability mode . This will install the game correctly , by-passing the faulty DX9 check , you can then run the game normally
TS7P-24E4-SRQK-MSR7-RRLD

Not working for me on Win7 64-bit.

#1)  There is no nfo file and thus, no serial. Thankfully, some have posted keys here.

#2) It won't get past the DirectX9 check. Setting compatibility mode does not affect this.

Thanks for the upload. Perhaps someone has encountered this issue and will offer suggestions.
If you get the DirectX 9 error on Windows 7, just download and install DirectX 9.0c and the problem is solved.

@vajlent

I would contend that the files are not corrupt, due to the many respondents that are running the game fine.  If you're getting a message about corrupt files, then it is YOUR files that are corrupt, meaning you had a downloading error.  Try downloading again.
